DataElement.preferredName: Observation Study Protocol Document Accrual Reporting Method Code AccrualReportingMethodType
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Watching something and taking note of what happens.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of data._The process of obtaining subjects for a study.:The act of providing a short account.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation._The code that represents the specification or format on how subject accrual data should be reported back to the study sponsor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Observation Study Protocol Document Accrual Reporting Method Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Watching something and taking note of what happens.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of data._The process of obtaining subjects for a study.:The act of providing a short account.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Watching something and taking note of what happens.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of data.

Concepts.definition: Watching something and taking note of what happens.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of obtaining subjects for a study.:The act of providing a short account.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: The process of obtaining subjects for a study.
The act of providing a short account.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 4/7/11 - no longer used by BRIDG; released for reuse by COPPA

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The code that represents the specification or format on how subject accrual data should be reported back to the study sponsor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A shortened form of a word or phrase.

Concepts.definition: A shortened form of a word or phrase.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 7/22/2021wz: released for UML model cleanup project.
